title: Japan's Shota Horie confident World Cup clash with Scotland won't be blown off course - but fears his house will be
text:
Japan prop Shota Horie says he is confident Sunday’s clash with Scotland will go ahead as scheduled and that Japan will win “of course”.

Horie added that he was not thinking about anything other than Japan progressing to the last eight of the competition for the first time, although he did admit he was worried that his house might be destroyed by Typhoon Hagibis.

"It's a typhoon of quite a size so I want all the Japanese citizens to be careful,” Horie said. “I think the [Scotland] match will go ahead, of course we'll win and progress to the last eight. I'm not thinking about anything else. I'm worried whether my house will be alright."

Horie hails from Suita in Osaka prefecture, which is in the...
description: Japan prop Shota Horie says he is confident Sunday’s clash with Scotland will go ahead as scheduled and that Japan will win “of course”.
